definitions.definition: To fail to see the difference; to mix up; to confuse right and wrong.

definitions.example: Don't confound the situation by yelling.

definitions.definition: To combine in a confused fashion; to mingle so as to make the parts indistinguishable.
To cause to be ashamed; to abash.
To defeat, to frustrate, to thwart.
The act by which things are confounded, or confused.
The process by which an apparent association between an exposure and an outcome is actually explained by another factor.
